description: Get keyword rankings, PPC data, and search engine rankings.

blocks.name: createSERPsJob
blocks.description: Creates a new job to be processed. Upon successfully accepting the request you will receive a job id (UUID) that can later be used to retrieve the SERPs data

args.name: searchEngine
args.info: The search engine to query. Examples: bing, google, yahoo, yandex, baidu

args.name: language
args.info: The language code to use. Default: en

args.name: searchType
args.info: The type of search to perform: web site or country. Default: web

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The number of results to return. Any number up to 500. Default: 100

args.name: strategy
args.info: The serps fetch strategy. standard - this is the default strategy, we will try to fetch SERPs with 10 results per page, so max_results: 100 will yield 10 pages. economic - we will try to fetch the first X pages with 10 results each then a last page with the remainder, so max_results: 100 will yield X+1 pages

args.name: fullPagesCount
args.info: Work only with strategy = Economic. Fetch the first full_pages_count pages with 10 results each then a last page with the remainder, so max_results: 100 will yield full_pages_count + 1 pages

args.name: userAgent
args.info: The user agent to use. See below

args.name: useCache
args.info: Wether to use cached data, if available

args.name: includeAllInUniversal
args.info: Wether to incude ads in universal section. Default false

blocks.name: getSERPsJob
blocks.description: Returns information about an existing job.
